conclusion: The frame is a square with side length l. The magnetic field has a width d and is uniform within this width. The frame moves with a constant speed v. The condition given is l < d.

premise: An induced current occurs when the magnetic flux through the frame changes.
conclusion: An induced current occurs when the frame is entering or exiting the magnetic field.
The front edge of the frame starts entering the magnetic field.

premise: The frame moves with a constant speed v and has a side length l.
conclusion: The time taken for the entire frame to enter the magnetic field is t_enter = l/v.

premise: Once the frame is completely inside the magnetic field, there is no change in flux until it starts to exit.
conclusion: The time taken for the entire frame to exit the magnetic field is t_exit = l/v.

premise: The total time during which there is an induced current is the sum of the time taken to enter and the time taken to exit the magnetic field.
conclusion: Total time: t_total = t_enter + t_exit = l/v + l/v = 2l/v.
